title: Car fans can now stay in this Mercedes-Benz themed flat
text:
0.00 
Oh Lord, won't you buy me a Mercedes (Xetra: 710000 - news ) -Benz property? 
Mercedes-Benz is driving in a new direction with the launch of a string of luxury flats that will allow fans of the German carmaker to bask in the brand even when not in their vehicles. 
From November, business travellers to London will be able to rent one of six Kensington apartments whose design has been inspired by a Mercedes-Benz car . 
In its first foray into residential property, Mercedes-Benz has partnered with Frasers Hospitality Group, the owner of Malmaison and Hotel du Vin, to attract business travellers and high net worth consumers to its brand in an attempt to emphasise its premium status . 
Mercedes-Benz is among the 20 most valuable brands in the world , according to the annual Best (LSE: 0M1A.L - news ) Global Brands (HKSE: 0787-OL.HK - news ) report, which recently valued it at $36.7bn (£23.7bn). 
"More and more people are permanently on the move," said Wilfried Steffen, head of the Mercedes-Benz Business Innovation department. "They live and work in unfamiliar cities where they are looking for a home away from home and a sense of security. That's exactly what we want to offer them." 
The properties, which offer 100 square metres of space, feature a "Black Magic Wall" that echoes the feature line of a car, a bespoke Swarovski chandelier, a glass table shaped like an S (Other OTC: UBGXF - news ) to represent a Mercedes S-class car , and silver-coloured furniture. 
The one- and two-bedroom flats, which can be rented for two months at a time, will be available for £300 to £400 per night. 
Nine similar apartments that are roughly 50 metres squared are set to open in Singapore in early 2016. Mercedes-Benz said it plans to rapidly expand the concept to other cities if the pilot is successful. 
This is not the first time that the car company has tried its hand at out-of-car experiences. Mercedes-Benz World, a museum and training centre, opened in Surrey in 2006.
